intro: Bonafousia siphilitica var. juruana, commonly known as the Jurua siphilitic bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom during the rainy season. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found growing along stream banks and in dense understory vegetation. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
